javadoc:
Dialog that is displayed to show activity for a Task that is running outside of the 
 Swing Thread.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: centerOnComp
params.comment:
component to be centered over when shown,
 otherwise center over parent.  If both centerOnComp and parent
 are null, dialog will be centered on screen.

params.name: task
params.comment: the Task that this dialog will be associated with

methods.javadoc:
Creates a new TaskDialog.
@param task the Task that this dialog will be associated with
methods.name: <init>

params.name: task
params.comment: the Task that this dialog will be associated with

methods.name: <init>

params.name: canCancel
params.comment: true if the task can be canceled

params.name: isModal
params.comment: true if the dialog should be modal

params.name: hasProgress
params.comment: true if the dialog should show a progress bar

methods.javadoc:
Sets the percentage done.
@param param The percentage of the task completed.
methods.name: setProgress

params.name: param
params.comment: The percentage of the task completed.

methods.javadoc: Sets the indeterminate property of the progress bar, which determines whether the progress bar is in determinate or indeterminate mode. An indeterminate progress bar continuously displays animation indicating that an operation of unknown length is occurring. By default, this property is false. Some look and feels might not support indeterminate progress bars; they will ignore this property. @see JProgressBar
methods.name: setIndeterminate
methods.comment:
Sets the indeterminate property of the progress bar,
 which determines whether the progress bar is in determinate
 or indeterminate mode.
 An indeterminate progress bar continuously displays animation
 indicating that an operation of unknown length is occurring.
 By default, this property is false.
 Some look and feels might not support indeterminate progress bars;
 they will ignore this property.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the message in the TaskDialog dialog
@param str The message string to be displayed
methods.name: setMessage
methods.comment: Sets the message in the TaskDialog dialog

params.name: str
params.comment: The message string to be displayed

methods.javadoc:
Set the enable state of the Cancel button.
@param enable the state to set the cancel button.
methods.name: setCancelEnabled
methods.comment: Set the enable state of the Cancel button.

params.name: enable
params.comment: the state to set the cancel button.

methods.name: show
methods.comment:
Shows the dialog window centered on the parent window.
 Dialog display is delayed if delay greater than zero.

params.name: delay
params.comment:
number of milliseconds to delay displaying of the task dialog.  If the delay is
 greater than #MAX_DELAY, then the delay will be #MAX_DELAY;

name: TaskDialog
comment:
Dialog that is displayed to show activity for a Task that is running outside of the 
 Swing Thread.
